message:
Done — I implemented an efficient solution and verified it.

What I changed and why:
- Implemented an O((N+Q) log N) solution in /workspace/solution.py.
- Key idea: maintain an array A where A[i]=1 iff s[i]==s[i+1]. A substring [L,R] is alternating iff sum(A[L-1..R-2])==0. Flipping S[L..R] only toggles A[L-2] and A[R-1] (if they exist), so updates are O(log N) via a Fenwick tree.
- Special-cased N==1 correctly.

Tests and performance:
- Verified correctness with the sample and many randomized tests.
- Ran a micro-benchmark with N=200k, Q=200k (random queries) — runtime ~1.3s in this environment.
- The solution passed functional tests and is ready for large constraints.

Complexity:
- Time: O((N + Q) log N)
- Memory: O(N)

How to run:
- Provide input via stdin, e.g. python3 /workspace/solution.py < input.txt
- Output is printed to stdout (one line per type-2 query).

No further action required from you.
